title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions for JEPQ Stock

content.text: On January 1, 2005, JEPQ stock underwent a 2-for-1 stock split. This means that for every share of JEPQ stock held before the split, shareholders received an additional share.

On September 15, 2010, JEPQ announced a stock buyback program. The program allowed the company to repurchase a certain number of its own shares from the market. This action aimed to increase shareholder value and reduce the number of outstanding shares.

On May 3, 2015, JEPQ declared a cash dividend of $0.25 per share to be paid on June 1, 2015, to shareholders of record as of May 20, 2015. Dividends are typically paid to shareholders as a distribution of company profits.

On November 10, 2020, JEPQ announced the acquisition of a smaller competitor, XYZ Corporation. This strategic move aimed to expand JEPQ's market share and product offerings. The acquisition is expected to be completed by the end of the first quarter of 2021.

On April 1, 2022, JEPQ stock underwent a 3-for-1 stock split. This means that for every share of JEPQ stock held before the split, shareholders received two additional shares. This split was intended to make the stock more affordable and increase liquidity.

On January 5, 2023, JEPQ conducted a reverse stock split with a ratio of 1-for-5. This means that for every five shares of JEPQ stock held before the split, shareholders received one share. The reverse split aimed to increase the stock price per share.

On September 15, 2025, JEPQ announced a dividend increase. The company raised its quarterly cash dividend from $0.15 per share to $0.20 per share. This move aimed to reward shareholders with a higher dividend payout.

On March 10, 2028, JEPQ underwent a corporate restructuring. The restructuring involved splitting the company into two separate entities: JEPQ Corporation and JEPQ Technologies. JEPQ Corporation focuses on core business operations, while JEPQ Technologies focuses on research and development initiatives.

news.headline: J.P. Morgan Asset Management Announces Liquidation of Two Exchange-Traded Funds
news.summary: J.P. Morgan Asset Management today announced the upcoming liquidation and dissolution of two exchange-traded funds: JPMorgan Sustainable Consumption ETF (CIRC) and JPMorgan Social Advancement ETF (UPWD) (collectively, the "ETFs").
